item.title: Report I-2025030065
item.description:
Report I-2025030065

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-06
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FedEx Office Print & Ship
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Executive summary: Receiving R&D laboratory received a package of biohazardous customer samples from another department within the facility that consisted of improper packaging, package marks, and shipping documentation. There us no known release of substance from the package. Packaging: Lack of proper packaging to support UN3373 shipment including: No absorbent material, Improper secondary closure (Ziploc bag), and Use of improper rigid packaging. identifier and substance name, Missing UN3373 label, Missing customer address ad relevant shipping support documentation. Receiving: Site properly utilized PPE to recover package and opened in laboratory to ensure no release of substance.

There us no known release of substance from the package. Packaging: Lack of proper packaging to support UN3373 shipment including: No absorbent material, Improper secondary closure (Ziploc bag), and Use of improper rigid packaging. identifier and substance name, Missing UN3373 label, Missing customer address ad relevant shipping support documentation. Receiving: Site properly utilized PPE to recover package and opened in laboratory to ensure no release of substance.

item.title: Report E-2025030477
item.description:
Report E-2025030477

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-02
  • City: WHEATON
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7200
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the hose adaptor and the storage tank became compromised. Approximately 50 gallons of gasoline was released. A small amount of gasoline was able to migrate to a nearby storm drain. Enviroserve responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
